CatDescriptText: Mr. Frederick Beasley, head houseman, Fifth Ward and Rev. Joey Kirby, Beltzhoover, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, December 30, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "Do you think the Christian Church is doing an effective job in improving racial amity in the city, nation and throughout the world?"  Mr. Beasley's answer reads: "They are trying to do an effective job, and in some cases, they are succeeding.  Overall, they have quite a long way to go on all levels."  Rev. Kirby's answer reads: "I think they are.  To me, it shouldn't take too long.  We've come a long way already."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Frederick Beasley standing in front of Bud Saunders flower shop, Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Rev. Joey Kirby wearing zippered leather jacket with dark knitted collar, standing under Jenkins Arcade marquee, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
